title: Ring of sustain attributes
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

| Type | Jewellery                                                                                                              |
| :--- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Ring of sustain attributes                                                                                             |
| Icon | [![Ring of sustain attributes.png](/images/9/91/Ring_of_sustain_attributes.png)](/File:Ring_of_sustain_attributes.png) |

|   |                                                                                            |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | This ring protects its wearer from the loss of their strength, dexterity and intelligence. |

The **ring of sustain attributes** cuts any temporary loss of [stats](/Stats "Stats") in half, rounding down. Note that most sources of stat loss cause you to lose a single point, so this ring completely negates those (e.g. [sickness](/Sickness "Sickness") and the [Deterioration mutation](/Bad_mutations#Deterioration "Bad mutations")).

This ring does **not** affect stat loss directly from [mutations](/Mutation "Mutation"), which are permanent.

## Strategy

Temporary stat loss is restored as you gain [XP](/XP "XP"). Most characters can easily recover from stat drain by killing monsters. However, characters with at least 1 low stat ([Berserkers](/Berserk "Berserk"), [Deep Elf](/Deep_Elf "Deep Elf") [Wizards](/Wizard "Wizard")...) are at risk of [stat zero](/Stat_zero "Stat zero"). Sustain attributes can help avoid this lethal status when fighting stat-draining monsters.

You'll receive far more stat drain in [the Tomb](/The_Tomb "The Tomb") ([death curses](/Death_curse "Death curse")) and [Hells](/Hell "Hell") ([Hell's mystical force](/Hell%27s_mystical_force "Hell's mystical force")). It's important to watch your stat levels when visiting these branches, putting on sustain attributes as necessary. Even if you aren't at risk of stat zero, losing stats will reduce your effectiveness in combat. Sustained attributes can also be useful if you're using a [crystal ball of energy](/Crystal_ball_of_energy "Crystal ball of energy") or the [staff of Wucad Mu](/Staff_of_Wucad_Mu "Staff of Wucad Mu").

## History

- Sustain attributes were removed in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"). Temporary stat losses were reduced to compensate.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), this item was called a **ring of sustain abilities**.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15") you received a cumulative effect for wearing two rings, reducing stat loss by 75%, thus entirely negating all stat damage dealt in increments of 3 or less.

| [Jewellery](/Jewellery "Jewellery") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

| [Rings](/Ring "Ring")               | [Dexterity](/Ring_of_dexterity "Ring of dexterity") • [Evasion](/Ring_of_evasion "Ring of evasion") • [Fire](/Ring_of_fire "Ring of fire") • [Flight](/Ring_of_flight "Ring of flight") • [Ice](/Ring_of_ice "Ring of ice") • [Intelligence](/Ring_of_intelligence "Ring of intelligence") • [Magical power](/Ring_of_magical_power "Ring of magical power") • [Poison resistance](/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance") • [Positive energy](/Ring_of_positive_energy "Ring of positive energy") • [Protection](/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection") • [Protection from cold](/Ring_of_protection_from_cold "Ring of protection from cold") • [Protection from fire](/Ring_of_protection_from_fire "Ring of protection from fire") • [Resist corrosion](/Ring_of_resist_corrosion "Ring of resist corrosion") • [See invisible](/Ring_of_see_invisible "Ring of see invisible") • [Slaying](/Ring_of_slaying "Ring of slaying") • [Strength](/Ring_of_strength "Ring of strength") • [Willpower](/Ring_of_willpower "Ring of willpower") • [Wizardry](/Ring_of_wizardry "Ring of wizardry") |
html:
Ring of sustain attributes

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
Type Jewellery
Name Ring of sustain attributes
Icon
This ring protects its wearer from the loss of their strength, dexterity and intelligence.

The ring of sustain attributes cuts any temporary loss of stats in half, rounding down. Note that most sources of stat loss cause you to lose a single point, so this ring completely negates those (e.g. sickness and the Deterioration mutation).

This ring does not affect stat loss directly from mutations, which are permanent.

Strategy

Temporary stat loss is restored as you gain XP. Most characters can easily recover from stat drain by killing monsters. However, characters with at least 1 low stat (Berserkers, Deep Elf Wizards...) are at risk of stat zero. Sustain attributes can help avoid this lethal status when fighting stat-draining monsters.

You'll receive far more stat drain in the Tomb (death curses) and Hells (Hell's mystical force). It's important to watch your stat levels when visiting these branches, putting on sustain attributes as necessary. Even if you aren't at risk of stat zero, losing stats will reduce your effectiveness in combat. Sustained attributes can also be useful if you're using a crystal ball of energy or the staff of Wucad Mu.

History

  • Sustain attributes were removed in 0.19. Temporary stat losses were reduced to compensate.
  • Prior to 0.17, this item was called a ring of sustain abilities.
  • Prior to 0.15 you received a cumulative effect for wearing two rings, reducing stat loss by 75%, thus entirely negating all stat damage dealt in increments of 3 or less.
Jewellery
Amulets Acrobat • Faith • Guardian spirit • Magic regeneration • Reflection • Regeneration
Rings Dexterity • Evasion • Fire • Flight • Ice • Intelligence • Magical power •
Poison resistance • Positive energy • Protection • Protection from cold • Protection from fire • Resist corrosion • See invisible • Slaying • Strength • Willpower • Wizardry

This ring does '''not''' affect stat loss directly from [[mutation]]s, which are permanent.

Temporary stat loss is restored as you gain [[XP]]. Most characters can easily recover from stat drain by killing monsters. However, characters with at least 1 low stat ([[Berserk]]ers, [[Deep Elf]] [[Wizard]]s...) are at risk of [[stat zero]]. You'll receive far more stat drain in [[the Tomb]] ([[death curse]]s) and [[Hell]]s ([[Hell's mystical force]]).
